repnme.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea - Economic Recovery
            Program Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Economic Recovery
            Program Loan Project for Papua New Guinea were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, project suitability was
            uncertain, Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the Bank strategy of taking a firm but
            reasoned stand on all of the loan conditions played a key
            role in bringing the program to a satisfactory conclusion.
            In particular, this consistency of position was crucial to
            bringing the program back on track at various points. More
            detailed attention needs to be focused on achieving and
            maintaining sustainable consensus for the reform program.
            From the beginning, support for the program was mixed and
            fragile because inadequate attention was given by Government
            to disseminating public information on the need for economic
            reform and on the objectives of the program. To ensure
            effective implementation of the reforms and their
            sustainability, solid and long term political commitment is
            needed. To this end, support for the reform program should
            be built by involving all elements of society including the
            bureaucracy, the polity and stakeholders in civil society.

repnme.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea - Economic Recovery
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Recovery Program (ERP) Loan
            Project is to support the first phase of the
            Government's economic reform program. To address the
            pressing stabilization and development issues facing Papua
            New Guinea, the ERP loan is designed to address only key
            macroeconomic and structural issues whose implementation is
            expected to stabilize the economy, begin the process of
            sustainable private-sector-led growth, while improving the
            delivery of public services and strengthen natural resource
            management, particularly forestry. It will assist the
            Government to build support among various stakeholders for
            the program by allocating higher share of public resources
            to essential public services through various distribution
            and service delivery systems, including non-governmental
            organizations (NGOs) and churches. The operation also
            includes implementation measures to initiate priority
            changes in the way the Government does business.
